content: darn in all loose threads work a second sock the same way but feel free to invert the colours if you feel so inclined woodruff page 4 further options - if you find the cuff in solid ribbing to heavy for the sock maybe use a striped rib instead or how about a picot cuff - simply inverting the distribution of light and dark colours will resort in a fairly different looking sock - of course you can easily substitute other types of heels and toes if you prefer although they are fairly instrumental to the overall look of the design if you change the heel make sure you pick up the same number of sts or the chart will not work glossary st sts stitch stitches k knit p purl sl slip k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches separately as if to knit insert left needle into these two stitches from the right and knit onto right needle p2tog purl 2 stitches together rs ws right side wrong side woodruff page 5 leg chart heel chart woodruff page 6 gusset chart woodruff page 7 foot chart toe chart woodruff page 8 glossary of symbols used knit on rs no stitch purl on ws knit 2 together slip slip knit make 1 new stitch by lifting bar between stitches and knitting into the back of it edge stitch - slip purl wise at beginning of each row knit with both strands at end of rs row purl with both strands at end of ws row woodruff page 9
